content.question: Ruyschâ€™s composition Fruits and Insects demonstrates her interest in

choices.label: reflecting how the subject matter would have been encountered in nature
mimicking a tabletop display found in a contemporary home
combining discrete scientific studies of the different plants and creatures
following a template provided by her teacher to emulate the Old Masters

content.answer: combining discrete scientific studies of the different plants and creatures

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.3: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
